Topic: Euclidean Algorithm, Primes, Binomial Coefficients, Congruences
Original question: tabulate the number of primes less than x, for x = 10000, 20000,..., 100000. Also tabulate the number of primes less than x and of the form 4k +1, and the number of the form 4k + 3
Solution:
You should notice that about 50% of the primes are 1 mod 4 and about 50% are 3 mod 4. Also, the
number of primes which are 3 mod 4 seems to be larger than the number of primes 1 mod 4, up to any
integer
